intro: Rinorea neglecta, commonly known as the white mistflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, white, five-petaled flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Rinorea neglecta is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
